pullRequest.body:
---

On its own this PR may seem strange, but this API is useful in #15321 to prove that discrete condensed sets are given by locally constant maps.

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [cefd72ff57](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15527/commits/cefd72ff57a61edb70426a4303fef18c6db12333)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Logic.Function.FiberPartition`|212|
| `Mathlib.Topology.FiberPartition`|680|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Fiber`
`+ eq_fiber_image`
`+ fiber_nonempty`
`+ image`
`+ image_eq_image_mk`
`+ instance (x : Fiber l) : CompactSpace x.val := by`
`+ instance : Finite (Fiber l)`
`+ map_eq_image`
`+ map_preimage_eq_image`
`+ map_preimage_eq_image_map`
`+ mem_iff_eq_image`
`+ mk`
`+ mkSelf`
`+ mk_image`
`+ preimage`
`+ sigmaIncl`
`+ sigmaInclIncl`
`+ sigmaIsoHom`
`+ sigmaIsoHom_inj`
`+ sigmaIsoHom_surj`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10940477145/job/30372987404)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10940477145/job/30372987142)

This won't work with the new `variable` algorithm. Please copy `f` syntax-explicitly into the statement:
```suggestion
def Fibers (f : Y  Z) : Type _ := Set.range (fun (x : Set.range f)  f ' {x.val})
```
Can you please add a proof of `Set.Nonempty a.1`?
I don't think so. It's used once in each directions in the application, as far as I can tell

`Nat` is not called `Nats`
```suggestion
def Fiber (f : Y  Z) : Type _ := Set.range (fun (x : Set.range f)  f ' {x.val})
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Topology): the partition of a space into fibers of a function

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Condensed): discrete condensed sets are given by locally constant maps
